page.title: 08Hunshelf's history.
page.content: Hunshelf appears to have been settled in Anglo_Saxon and Viking times judging by placenames.For instance,{ {"Carr Head"}is associated with a Viking settlement.There are several springs in the area,as well as two "cloughs",indicating past communication problems.An important landowner,Major De Wend Fenton lived in the centre of Hunshelf. In the past 200 years,quarries and pits for stone,coal and iron ore have operated in the area.A hexagonal stone monument in Hunshelf bears witness to this.The centre of Hunshelf has links with the salt trade in Cheshire and Lancashire through{Salter Hill Lane,Tenter Lane and{Cloth Hall Farm}indicate Hunshelf's former links with the cotton trade.In 1794 Jonathon Denton tried to establish a cotton mill,which later became Samuel Foxes steel works.
